name: Network Access Groom
title: NAG
definition: Identifies this service request as a CFA or CCEA change which will require no contact with the end user at the terminating location (SECLOC).
usageNotes: Optional when the first position of the REQTYP field is “S”, the ACT field is “N” or “D”, the RPON field is populated, the NSL field on the Transport Form is not populated and a Network Access Groom is being requested.
Optional when the first position of the REQTYP field is “S”, the ACT field is “C”, the NSL field on the Transport Form is not populated and a Network Access Groom is being requested.
fieldNotes: This field applies only when the Primary, Secondary, Intermediary CFA or CCEA is changing and the end user terminating location is not changing.
Population of this field indicates that the provider will use existing end user location information on record for the circuit(s) being groomed.
